str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To dine, sup, eat. From deipnon; to dine, i.e. Take the principle meal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and zonnumi; to gird all around, i.e. to fasten on one's belt.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
